file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-60-02-02 - FLOTATION VEST - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FLOTATION VEST - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section refers you to the publication necessary to put the flotation vest back to a serviceable condition. B. The crew flotation vest is installed on the back of the LH/RH cockpit crew seats, in the structure of the forward flight attendant seat, below the inboard seat of the last row of double passenger- seats, and in the RH aft console. C. Optionally, the passenger flotation vest is installed in a pouch below each passenger seat. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 25-60-02-900-801-A ♦ FLOTATION VEST - RESTORE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-60-02 Page 1 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-60-02-900-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FLOTATION VEST - RESTORE A. General (1) The function of this inspection is to find degradation and violation of the packaging of the flotation vest. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION CMM Air Cruisers 25-64-02 - CMM C&D ZODIAC 63600-501 - CMM Hoover Industries 2000-105Y - CMM Hoover Industries 3505-101CW - CMM Hoover Industries 3505-101W - CMM Hoover Industries 3505-111CW - CMM Nordisk 35-21-02 - CMM RFD Beaufort Limited MK20SV - CMM RFD Beaufort Limited MK22SV - CMM RFD Beaufort Limited MK3 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE On the back of the LH/RH cockpit crew seats, in the structure of the forward flight attendant seat, below the inboard seat of 1 Does the task the last row of double passenger-seats, in the RH aft console, and in a pouch under each passenger seat EMB-145 - AMM 1285 900-801-A/200 25-60-02 Page 2 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Restore Flotation Vest SUBTASK 900-006-A (1) Remove the flotation vest from the pouch. (2) Do the inspection of the flotation vest as follows: (a) Inspect the flotation vest for violation of its packaging. NOTE: Use the procedures described on the servicing and maintenance section of the latest revision of the CMM according to the list below, to put the flotation vest back to a serviceable condition: • CMM Hoover Industries 3505-101CW. • CMM Hoover Industries 3505-101W. • CMM Hoover Industries 3505-111CW. • CMM Hoover Industries 2000-105Y. • CMM RFD Beaufort Limited MK3. • CMM RFD Beaufort Limited MK20SV. • CMM RFD Beaufort Limited MK22SV. • CMM C&D ZODIAC 63600-501. • CMM Nordisk 35-21-02. • CMM Air Cruisers 25-64-02. (3) Put the flotation vest back into the pouch. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 900-801-A/200 25-60-02 Page 3 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
